Title: Save your heart health by following these practical steps
Festivals: ['Purbeck Film Festival', 'Leiden International Film Festival', 'Tokyo International Film Festival', 'Banff Centre Mountain Film and Book Festival', 'Tokyo International Film Festival', 'Brauschweig International Film Festival', 'Climate Crisis Film Festival', 'Film Festival Cottbus', 'Abertoir International Horror Festival of Wales 1', 'Aesthetica Short Film Festival', 'Lübeck Nordic Film Days', 'The Valley Film Festival', 'Ibero American Film Festival', 'Denver Film Festival', 'Les Gai Cine Mad', 'UK Green Film Festival', 'Leeds International Film Festival', 'Sydney Film Festival', 'Miami GEMS Film Festival', 'FILMZ - Festival des deutschen Kinos', 'Belfast Film Festival', 'Ankara Film Festival', 'Hawaii International Film Festival', 'Belo Horizonte International Short Film Festival', 'Arlington International Film Festival', 'Ojai International Film Festival', 'London Korean Film Festival', 'Mezipatra Queer Film Festival', 'Fort Lauderdale International Film Festival', 'Buffalo Dreams Fantastic Film Festival', 'Geneva International Film Festival', 'Arras Film Festival', 'MedFilm Festival', 'Thessaloniki International Film Festival', 'New Orleans Film Festival', 'Cork International Film Festival']
Narrative:
Cardiovascular Diseases is one of the world's leading killer which is a cause for 1 in every 3 deaths. And to have a better heart health it is never too late. Here are some of the practical steps 

• Eat a heart healthy diet

• If overweight, lose weight

• Overweight us defined as the BMI of 25 or above. Central obesity or adiposity on the other hand is a high waist circumference which is more than 80 cm for females and 90 cm for males.

• Increase regular physical activity to at least 2.5 hours per week

• Don’t use tobacco

• Avoid use of alcohol

• Have your blood pressure and blood sugar checked regularly

Sources - WHO
